conversation.content: Provide a 1 paragraph biography of the actor

conversation.chosen: Michael B. Jordan (born February 9, 1987) is an American actor and film producer. He is best known for his portrayal of superhero Adonis Creed in the "Creed" film series, as well as starring roles in "Fruitvale Station", "Black Panther", and "Without Remorse".

conversation.chosen: Anne Jacqueline Hathaway is an American actress born on November 12, 1982 in Brooklyn, New York. She is best known for her roles in films such as "The Princess Diaries", "The Devil Wears Prada", and "Les Misérables" for which she won an Academy Award. Hathaway has also starred in several other successful movies including "Ocean's Eight" and "Interstellar". In addition to acting, she is also involved with various charitable causes and is known for her activism and philanthropy. Throughout her career, Hathaway has received numerous accolades and nominations for her work in film, television, and stage productions. She continues to act and produce content while being a mother to her son Jonathan Rosebanks Shulman whom she gave birth to on March 24, 2016.
conversation.rejected:
Anne Jacqueline Hathaway (born November 12, 1982) is an American actress. One of the highest-paid actresses in the world in 2015, she has received multiple awards, including an Academy Award, a Primetime Emmy Award, and a Golden Globe Award. Her films have made over $6.8 billion globally, and she appeared on the Forbes Celebrity 100 list from 2009 to 2019.

Hathaway graduated from Millburn High School in New Jersey in 1999 and enrolled at Vassar College, but took time off to pursue acting. She began her career as a stage actress, making her Broadway debut in 2002 with the short-lived musical "Cinderella." She went on to star in several films, including "The Princess Diaries" (2001), "Ella Enchanted" (2004), "Brokeback Mountain" (2005), "The Devil Wears Prada" (2006), "Becoming Jane" (2007), "Rachel Getting Married" (2008), "Valentine's Day" (2010), "Love & Other Drugs" (2010), "Les Misérables" (2012), "Interstellar" (2014), "Ocean's Eight" (2018), and "The Witches" (2020).

In addition to her acting work, Hathaway is also involved in activism and social causes. In 2010, she was named a UN Women Goodwill Ambassador, advocating for gender equality and women's rights.

conversation.chosen: Daniel J. Levy, commonly known as Dan Levy, is a Canadian actor, writer, and director. He was born on August 9, 1983 in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Levy is most recognized for creating and starring in the critically acclaimed TV show Schitt's Creek alongside his father Eugene Levy. For his performance in the show, he won several awards including the Emmy Award for Outstanding Comedy Series in 2020. Aside from Schitt's Creek, Levy has appeared in other TV shows and films such as The Great North, Brockmire, and The To Do List. Additionally, he has done voice-over work for animated series like Archer and Big Mouth. Beyond his acting career, Levy is active in LGBTQ+ advocacy and serves as a board member for the organization GLAAD.
conversation.rejected:
Daniel J. Levy (born August 9, 1983) is a Canadian actor, writer, director, and producer. He is best known for creating and starring in the CBC sitcom Schitt's Creek, which he co-created with his father, Eugene Levy. For his performance in the show, Levy won the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series in 2020, becoming the first openly gay man to win in any lead comedy category.

Levy was born in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, into a family of comedians and entertainers. His mother, Deborah Divine, is a former television writer and producer, while his father, Eugene Levy, is a well-known actor, comedian, and writer. Growing up, Levy often accompanied his father on set and developed an early interest in filmmaking. After graduating from high school, he attended York University in Toronto, where he studied film production.

Prior to Schitt's Creek, Levy had worked extensively in television and film, appearing in shows such as MTV's "The Assistants," ABC Family's "Switched at Birth," and FX's "Man Seeking Woman." He also wrote and directed several short films and web series, including "Molly's White Boots" and "The Worst Kind of Thievery." However, it was Schitt's Creek that brought him widespread recognition and acclaim. The show premiered in 2015 and followed the misadventures of the Rose family, who lost everything and were forced to rebuild their lives in a small town called Schitt's Creek. Over its six seasons, the show became a critical and popular success, earning numerous award nominations and wins,
